title:
Hilbert space embeddings of independence tests of several variables with
  radial basis functions
abstract:
In this paper, we characterize several classes of continuous radial basis
functions that can be employed to determine whether a interaction of a
probability is zero or not. These functions encompass standard independence
tests but also the Lancaster/Streitberg interactions, and are multivariate
extensions of Bernstein functions. Addressing a gap in these two probability
contexts of interactions, we introduce an indexed measure of independence that
generalizes the Lancaster interaction. We present several examples of these
functions derived from high-order completely monotone functions.
